page.title: 06ONE DAY IN ROSIE'S LIFE : 1
page.content: My name is Rosie,I am 11 and I live on a farm in Chatsworth Park. I get up at 7.30, wash my face, brush my teeth and get dressed in my blue blouse and red jumper. Then I have breakfast of toast with butter and jam. I put on my shoes, brush my hair, walk to the bus-stop and climb on the blue and beige "Silver Service" bus. I pay the driver 15p and 15 minutes later arrive at Baslow School. At 9.o'clock we walk inside for registration. I give my teacher Â£2:25 for the week's dinners. After Assembly, the class returns from the hall for an hour's maths - I am working on "Probability", and after break, an hour's English, followed by dinner time.
